Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: MTNR_FAN
Reviews.Content: Very close to termini station and convenient to get around anywhere in the city. The staff was excellent, especially the lady concierge (unfortunately I didn't catch her name), who went above and beyond to make arrangements for our city excursions. The room was very clean, although the bathroom did smell a little sometimes and the shower stall was cramped, even for a skinny guy like me. The beds are very comfortable and they even gave us special pillows upon request. The breakfast is okay with scrambled eggs, breads and jams, and internet is free. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the city center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Anne B”
Reviews.Author: anne63Preston
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, clean, helpful staff, Basic in a way but really nice. Just ask if you want anything.i asked for boiled eggs on day one and then every morning they were done as soon as i walked in and no need to ask. English movie channel and news channel. Tip from Airport you can get a bus instead of the train bus return 6 euros. When you get of the bus at Termini Station Look t your left and you will see the Hotel Siracusa. At this hotel turn left down via Margaria ... cross one road and hotel on your right. so easy . On the return trip you take your ticket to the office 20 mins before you leave and they give you a card and this guarantees you your place so easy and so much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in good location for Termini station.”
Reviews.Author: cliffy60
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel with airmiles, so it was kind of 'free,' so I really have nothing to complain about. Location was in easy walking distance of the station. It is rated as 4 star, but in any other European country it would struggle to get 3 stars. Rooms were small, but adequate. After all, in this city, who wants to stay indoors a moment longer than you need to? Cleanliness could have been better, e.g. dusty on horizontal surfaces, and glasses in rooms needed another rinse before use. Extractor fan in bathroom not working. Air conditioning noisy and either froze or baked you depending on its mood! Breakfast buffet was good, but beware of the bacon, which was about as palatable as shoe leather. Staff were pleasant and efficient. Mini bar in room was very reasonably priced, certainly compared with the outrageous prices charged in the UK. All in all, nothing major to complain about. My leaving tip? If you're travelling as a couple or a family get the hotel to order a taxi for your return trip to the airport. It is not much more expensive than the train, and the route out of the city will take you past many of the great sights, so it is a perfect way to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location, well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi H
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable, in great location. We stayed for 2 days while visiting Roma for our daughters senior trip. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean throughout our stay. Having not ever been to Roma, we didnt know what to expect and we were pleasently surprised after reading some posts. though Terimini station can be rough, it was quiet and seemed safe on this side. we had no problems and walked all over at night. yes, a double is 2 singles around here but not a big deal. breakfast was just ok, but you shouldn't waste food budget in a hotel anyway. We would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: Yasemin8
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quiet street just 3 mins from Termini train station, the Metro and local bus network, the location was perfect. All the staff were very polite, welcoming, friendly and helpful. Our standard double room exceeded expectations and was most attractive, well equipped with a large comfortable bed, and was kept immaculate throughout our stay. The buffet breakfast was always a welcome start to the day and freshly prepared offering plenty of choice. Wi-fi was good. We would also recommend Mama Angela's Trattoria in nearby Via Palestro if you want to have supper close by.

Reviews.Title: “A different kind of 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinergetic
Reviews.Content: I thought that there is only one type of 4 stars hotel, but it seems that I was wrong. The only REAL 4 stars hotel we’ve been so far (and we travel through 9 countries within 5 years and stayed in many hotels) was Hotel Maxim in Verona, Italy. I cannot say Royal Court would really fit to this level. First of all, I would specifically NOT recommend this hotel for winter period. Their heating system is based on air conditioning and the bathrooms are not heated. For a bathroom made of marble, floor and walls, this can be a problem: it’s almost like a freezer. This problem was increased by the fact they did NOT provide sleepers (and we thought we are coming to a 4 stars hotel and we did not take sleepers with us). Imagine how is to get from a sort of heated room into the freezing bathroom, with the marble floor and sit on the icy toilet. It reminded me what I read about the tortures from medieval era. Paying 90 euro/night for this seemed a bit masochistic. The breakfast was ok, with few options, including scrambled eggs and bacon, muesli and yogurt, salami, yellow cheese, few different fruits, coffee and tea, juices and some chocolate cake. Compared with the royal breakfast we had in Maxim (for 58 euro/night), this one was pretty lame. The staff was excellent, especially Mary and Donald. If it was not for Mary, we would have left before checking in. The Italian guy (I believe he was Italian) seemed a bit insolent. We would probably go again to Rome, there are so many more things to see and visit, but for sure we will chose a different hotel, wisely this time. There are few more unpleasant details but I am too disappointed to talk about them anymore. For sure it's not worth it for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Suited the basic needs I had but lacked the 4 star feel.”
Reviews.Author: Xihuateteo
Reviews.Content: If comparing to an American 4 star hotel, this falls way short. I reserved a Deluxe room but it was more of a standard room. Lacked walking space between the entrance and the bathroom. The bed although a queen size took 90% of the room itself. The hotel provides basic wifi and satellite tv. The wifi was good only because the hotel was not full, but the tv lacked variety as it only provided one English channel (BBC) and the other 9 channels were either in Italian or French. The movie channel however offered the movies in English but you'd have to watch at around 2 or 4 am to do so. Breakfast was average a typical cold cut sandwich and fruits were offered in the basement where the dinning room is located. The only positive thing I have to say is that it is conveniently located down the street from the Termini Station which made it worth the effort. Line A will take you to most of the sites most commonly sought after and the Line B (blue line) will take you to the other 2 spots. The train station also provides a train to the airport, however, the hotel provides a shuttle service to the airport if you stay a total of 3 days or more. But you must ensure to have that included when you make your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay ...”
Reviews.Author: holo69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days in September 2011. The room was beautiful, clean, had free wireless internet, and a nice little private courtyard right outside our door. The frontdesk staff were very helpful and spoke English. The location is extremely convenient as the street its on leads right up to the main Termini railway station - just a short few minutes walk. You can catch trains around Rome or even around Italy right from this station! We caught the train to Florence from here, and being close to the station made the transfers really easy. I was initially unsure about booking here as I'd read reviews of other hotels close to the Termini station saying it's a bad area. That's true on the OTHER side of the station. Not this side. We arrived at 11pm and its a busy, safe area to walk the few hundred meters to the Hotel. Overall - its a comfortable, charming hotel with a fantastic location and great service. Can't fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Salvey
Reviews.Content: On my second trip to Rome I stayed here. Situated 2minutes walk from Stazione Termini, it was perfect for us. I went with three other friends. We, at the time, were all 18. We didn't go to Rome for the nightclubs or anything like that, we went for a good time and this place fitted the bill perfectly. We booked off lastminute.com and got a great deal to start off with. When we arrived the cheerful receptionist welcomed us and began to check us in and invited us to sit down and relax. As she completed the process, she called me over and informed me that she was upgrading us, FREE OF CHARGE to a delux quadruple room instead of our standard room. When we went in the room, it was perfect. Enough room for what we wanted, comfortable beds and everything clean. The only let down was the fact that the jacuzzi didn't work but, we could deal with that very easily!! We went out every night in Rome and found ti very easy to get a taxi back to Termini and walk up Via Marghera. We were usually home around 12 which was fine and walked straight in. One night we came home about 2am after meeting and talking to two local Romans. When we got back to the hotel, we found that the main gate had been locked. However we simply rang the buzzer and the receptionist came out, smiling again, to let us in and wished a good nights sleep. The staff were all very polite and went out of their way to make us happy on a number of occasions. I will definitely be going back to this hotel. ON A SIDE NOTE. ANYONE GOING TO ROME SOON, BE SURE TO GO TO THE "MERULANA CAFE" FOR A MEAL AND DRINK. THE HOST, CLAUDIO, IS A VERY NICE MAN AND AGAIN, MADE US FEEL VERY WELCOME. THE MERULANA IS SITUATED AT THE TOP OF VIA MERULANA IS FAIRLY CHEAP TO GET TO BY TAXI AND THE BUS GOES STRAIGHT PASS AS WELL!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable convenient located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vermeer123
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for it's location near main train station Termini. It is 5 minutes walk in a nice and quiet street. This side of the station is safe and good. The room was comfortable, good beds. Nice and lovely girl at the reception. If you need something near the station I would defenitly recommend this one. If you don't mind walking you can walk to most mayor attractions in the city. Otherwise you can take a bus or metro from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AMLondon2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in early December. It was our first time in Rome, and Hotel Royal Court couldn't be easier to find. We took an airport shuttle from the airport which dropped us outside Termini station, and the hotel is located on a street across the road from the station. Don't let this fool you - the hotel is at least a three minute walk down the street and extremely quiet. The reception staff are friendly and extremely helpful, and we were able to check into our room early. The room itself was spacious and clean, and the bathroom had a pretty powerful shower which is always appreciated. We didn't eat at the hotel, but the reception staff were helpful in pointing us in the direction of local restaurants. While the hotel isn't located in a particularly touristy part of town, we never felt unsafe walking around at night, and being a short walk to Termini meant we were always ten minutes from any of the main sights (Vatican City, Colosseum etc.) Only negatives were: 1. Our 'bed' was two single beds pushed together. However, we did only confirm our booking three days before checking in so we didn't expect anything different! 2. The room above us wasn't very soundproof, which I'm sure is due to the wood flooring. However, we only noticed it early in the morning with the sound of furniture moving? Despite this, Hotel Royal Court is excellent value for money and we would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice !”
Reviews.Author: lenIsrael
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to stay ! Quit and clean with great service ! And with rich breakfast .made us feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, quiet & clean, efficient staff, free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome. The situation couldn't be better. Very close to Termini but in a safe and quiet location with several close eateries. Breakfast was very good with wonderful coffee. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, water was piping hot. Wi-fi worked well. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable with good spoken English. Not a five-star establishment but everything that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel close to temini”
Reviews.Author: casatorres55
Reviews.Content: first time at this hotel and were booked in toa room which was quite small, the bed was hard and after the first night, told reception and they swapped us to a much bigger and better room with a softer bed!. very well decorated throughout. we were on B and B and the breakfast was good, the staff were all very helpful and friendly, plenty of powerful hot water in the shower!. On their web site it says that they charge for wi-fi so i left my lap top at home but when i got there they said it was free so that was slightly dissapointing. After a full day doing touristy things it would have been nice to come back after a meal out to a nice bar and lounge area, it doesnt have one. Thats about the only negative thing I can say about the royal court, all the rest are positives, its a nice hotel, within walking distance of the termini and the airport buses.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahpWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Rome and stayed at The Royal Court hotel. We had a lovely stay here, well placed for hisorical sights and close to the termini station. The staff were very helpful especially the lady on reception when we checked in early evening and she showed interest on our return to the hotel each day on our return as to where we visited that day. Breakfast was very enjoyable and had a good choice from cooked bacon and eggs to fresh fruit, cereal etc The room was clean and comfortable although the bed was on the hard side, the bathroom was clean and had a jacuzzi bath which was ideal for relaxing after a busy day sightseeing!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: eseliv
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive hotel near Termini station and this hotel perfectly fits the bill. Nothing fancy, but clean, close to Termini station and staff was friendly. My wife forgot her jeans in the hotel, so she called and hotel kept her jeans and returned it back a week later when we were returned to Roma to catch flight back home. Hotel is close to Termini train station, so if you have piece of luggage on wheels you can walk to Termini startion. Very helpful if you plan to travel from Rome or use subway. There are also tourist "Hop On Hop Off" buses stops near Termini station. Wi-fi is free and worked fine in the hotel, there no free breakfast, but there is a lot of places to eat close by. Definetely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: DocRB
Reviews.Content: Nice people (especially Mary at Reception), convenient to Termini station, price good, only big negative is it's dirty. The wood floor appeared to have been vacuumed but not mopped in a long time. Tissue would go dirty on wiping the floor. Shower heads in two rooms were all corroded and spray water everywhere. Most room would be quiet, even in a business neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit, just as good as I remembered”
Reviews.Author: Kath60
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in 2010 and couldn't fault it, so returned again this year and enjoyed it just as much.The location is perfect if you are arriving from the airport at Termini station as it is only about 5 minutes walk away. We managed to walk virtually everywhere from the hotel (take comfy walking shoes!) but it was easy to hop onto the metro from Termini to visit places further out, such as the Vatican city. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the location is very quiet for such a busy city. Breakfast was the usual help yourself buffet style with eggs and bacon as a hot option, but as someone wlse mentioned, if you like a drink in your room then bring a travel kettle with you as there is none in the room.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in central rome, great for termini”
Reviews.Author: sellyManchester
Reviews.Content: lovely room with fab bedding and furnishings. if you like a cuppa in the morning tho, take your travel kettle.a 4* hotel should have tea/coffee making facilities. didn't have breakfast, felt it was over-priced. staff very friendly and helpful.excellent location for termini station and central rome attractions. 2/3 mins walk from station and 15/20 mins walk to coliseum, trevi, pantheon etc. not cheap but okay by rome's standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fans123
Reviews.Content: Great to find such a good hotel so close to the train station in Rome. This small, clean hotel was a pleasant surprise. Helpful staff. Great breakfast. I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “All Good”
Reviews.Author: somefeedback
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to have stayed at the Hotel Royal Court. It was a reasonable price (for Rome, anyway), just a couple of blocks from the Termini/Train Station. We were able to leave bags with the bellman on arrival and departure days. The room was clean, in good repair, and a reasonable size for a European hotel. The bathroom was just fine too. For the money, we feel that we received a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: caraandrew
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny boutique hotel - the rooms were small but very nicely decorated , very clean. The bathroom were very modern and totally updated. The staff let us leave our luggage there as we left rome for the weekend to travel to Capri and Sorrento. We picked this location because we wanted to be close to the train station (three small blocks to the train terminal) and all public transportation (bus and metro). The public transportation was the main reason why we picked this hotel. For example It was a good location easy to take the metro to Colessum and took the bus to st peters. Did not use the restaurant ,only ordered coffee. We were happy with our choice. We stayed in both room 310 and 306 which had a big closet., both had a safe

Reviews.Title: “Great solution”
Reviews.Author: Mattcro
Reviews.Content: We were worrying about our reservation for our recent trip to' Europe because we have never been in Rome before and had no idea where to stay. The hotel was clean, nice and in a safe area. Just a few blocks from the metro. We arrived by train. The hotel is just 2 blocks from the Termini station ( in the very quiet part). Breakfast was nice and we enjoyed it very much. The staff all spoke english and they went out of their way to make our stay great. Whenever I am in Rome I will return to the Royal Court.

Reviews.Title: “Very good if you need a hotel near termini”
Reviews.Author: Pappone78
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice rooms, quite spatious. The building has some charm as well. Only minus maybe: the lobby is very small, but I really didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulus”
Reviews.Author: Edgarwilli
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train from the airport. The hotel is just two blocks away. We were pleasantly greeted and the reception manager assisted us very warmly. The room was so much more than I expected. The bathroom was huge and stocked with products. The breakfast buffet has a variery of things, effe, meats, fruit, cereals, croissants, ecc. The reception manager (nice lucking guy I think Gianmarco) was extremely helpful. I loved this hotel and the kindness of the staff and would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!!”
Reviews.Author: Hansi1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Royal Court for my birthday in May and had a fantastic time. The room we had was a double. Our bed was just so comfortable, we had the best nights sleep there, however we did walk for miles every day. Breakfast was a buffet service and was adeguate. Croissants, fruit, jogurt, cakes & pastries, scrambled egg, bacon. I particularly found the gentlemen ( Giancarlo & Andrea) at the reception extremely helpful. They gave us a map and directions for all major sights and nothing was too much trouble. Even down to bus numbers- however we walked everywhere. Upon return to the hotel they would always ask where we had gone and our views on the places. Rome is fantastic city and everything about is great. Would certainly go back and would use the Royal Court again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: letigiac21
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Royal court and it was perfect. The hotel is located at only few minutes from the train station and from the metro. The room was on the secon floor, very clean, spacious and with wifi which is very important. The staff is just great and very friendly. The food and the service at the breakfast room was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “A very welcoming and enjoyable stay. Fantastic service and 2 mins walk to main station”
Reviews.Author: Amester84
Reviews.Content: A quiet yet very friendly hotel with great customer service. We stayed at the hotel on our honeymoon and were immediately impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel and it's rooms. Checking in was quick and easy at the front reception and we had a porter take our bags upstairs for us. Our room was spacious enough for the 2 of us, and included a desk, wardrobe, bedside tables and TV. An upgraded room includes a jacuzzi bath which is very much needed after a day of exploring the city! We had breakfast included as part of our stay, which was a continental breakfast and provided a wide choice of cooked breakfast, cereal, pastries, etc- quite delicious! The hotel is about 5 minutes walk to the Rome Termini, the main bus and train station, including the metro. There is also the option to travel on the open top bus right around Rome which also leaves from outside the station. If you want to walk around Rome, it is not far until you reach the nearest Piazza, and all main sightseeing areas are in walking distance.The furthest away is the Vatican which both the metro and open top bus stop near. There are a range of restaurants within walking distance and variety of shops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Dimitri59
Reviews.Content: We stayed few days at this hotel and it was perfect.the staff is very friendly and helpful, the location is very close to' the metro and train station. The room was very clean and spacious. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sgbiedron
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for more than 6 years. I have stayed for a month at a time - even when I came to Rome to have our first child! The hotel is comfortable, quiet, secure, and clean. It is in a great location. It is a few blocks from the Termini and there are always taxis available if you do not want to walk around. They have a great layout at breakfast. They are great with our dogs and permit them to stay alone in the room as they are well behaved. They have big bathrooms as well and if you ask nicely, you will get a big fuzzy bathrobe. They help with everything you could think of - even last minute printing of air tickets or helping organize big dinners for friends. PLUS they have FREE wireless unlike all the big chain places. Their staff is amazing. I especially like the garden court in the warmer months and the top floor patio area for wine drinking. They also work with a garage a couple blocks away that is cheap and they even come to get the car from you. I have recommended this hotel to colleagues both in the states and in Europe and they have not been disappointed. This is truly my home away from home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and definitely not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cadamsky
Reviews.Content: I booked the trip to rome as a surprise trip for my husband's birthday and everything was great, til we got to the hotel. The room was smelling strongly of cleaning agents ( bathroom was smelling like of sewage and they used cleaning products to mask the smell) as the smell was unbearable we requested to change room... only to be told that none are available. After numerous conversations we managed to get a different room, however only to have first the minibar to break and then the bed. Unfortunately we had to spend one night of no sleep as one of the legs of the bed was broken and as such we had to wait til the following day for a handy man. The staff in charge there are definitely not solution orientated nor were they that interested in pleasing or looking after their customers! A total let down, and a shame as I really wanted the trip to be memorable and it's a shame that 4 starts does not stand for what it used to!

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel, shame we couldn't stay there the entire time we had booked!”
Reviews.Author: Mdcher
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Royal Court at 23:30 for a four night stay having travelled into the city from the airport by train to be greeted with the news that we had been upgraded to an executive room but in another hotel because they had problems with some rooms because of the rain. We never found out if that was the real reason or they had just overbooked but we were too tired to make much of a fuss and were put in a taxi to another hotel on the other side of the station. The room at the other hotel was clean but very tired and shabby so, given the option of moving back the following morning we decided to do so considering we knew that the Royal Court had been refurbished. We left our luggage in the room when we went out for the day and in the evening returned to the Royal Court where it was waiting for us in our new room so we were not particularly inconvenienced in the end. After all of that the Royal Court turned out to be an excellent little hotel. Our standard double room was just the right size for the two of us with a decent sized bathroom and was all spotlessly clean and decorated to a decent standard although the colour scheme was slightly unusual. Our only real complaint about the room was the lack of storage space with just a wardrobe containing a hanging rail and one shelf and a small drawer in the desk for hiding anything away, in addition to an open shelf in each bed side unit. We also had a bit of an issue with a nocturnal lady next door who had a very loud voice which did not seem to be blocked at all by the wall. It must have been something to with her voice because we rarely heard any of her companions' side of the conversation. Breakfast was what you would expect in continental Europe and the service from all of the staff was good with a couple of excellent restaurant recommendations by the girl who is on reception during the afternoon and evening although they were a bit of a walk away. The surrounding area seemed fine safety wise and the hotel is probably closer to the station concourse than the platform that the airport train uses. (My ratings ignore the problems on the first night, taking their word that it was out of their control)

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: honkiehoteler
Reviews.Content: Was a bit late in booking, so my options were limited. Generally, a decent hotel with a nice atmosphere (not the usual standard hotel). Very nice rooms with the authentic Italian design you want when you're in Rome, though very small and not very quite. Rather hard bed. Breakfast was good, enough to choose from. Location is not bad, central and close to the railway station, but still a bit of a walk, pleasant though, to get to places. No gym. If it weren't for the price (too high for what you get), I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel close to the main train station”
Reviews.Author: ship44
Reviews.Content: This is a typical B&B, clean, fresh towels and close to the main train station. The only downfault is that is a bit of a walk to the city centre and the selection of good restaurants is very limited. A bit pricey too, but by Rome standards is average.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooks Even on Prepaid Rooms”
Reviews.Author: travel2010000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I was arriving late at night into Rome and wanted somewhere close to the station and safe to sleep before departing in the morning. When I arrived at the hotel they told me there was a "problem" with the hotel. There was no problem, they had simply overbooked. They told me they would take me to their sister hotel and "upgrade" me. They took me to their sister hotel, which was in a completely different area of town. I was not upgraded, but placed in the smallest room in the sister hotel. At first I thought I would at least give them credit for making the alternate arrangements on what I presumed was a one-off. However, as I was browing through the stationary package in the room I found a filled-in comment card which had not been removed from the room and which made it clear that the same thing had happened to the previous occupant! Were I not so tired I would have raised more of a fuss. Completely unacceptable when rooms are prepaid and guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: handsoff22
Reviews.Content: Booked for 5 nights, double room, on holiday. We believe best money value in Rome, room was clean, service was excellent, location brilliant and the staff was very friendly. Only problem we had was the hotel informed me during the booking that my American Express was declined, and it should not have as the are funds in it. Had to give them a VISA card and then on check out paid with AMEX (????) Great steak and mexican restaurant - Charro Cafe (www.charrocafe.it), but make reservation first. Take tube from Termini to Pyramid station, walking dictance from there. Best steak I had for a long time :)

Reviews.Title: “2 blocks from the train station on a quiet block...newly furnished....”
Reviews.Author: QYvonne
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay close to the station for the last leg of our trip, catdhing an early flight 3 days later....and, given all the rather seedy accomodations in the neighborhood that were within our moderate price range, this hotel knocked the ball out of the park! A lovely place in a refurbrished beauiful old small mansion house...we chose a plan without breakfast which lowered our cost considerably. The people at the desk were extremely helpful and friendly, particularly the young woman who works afternoons and evenings...and, we had free wifi in our room!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, situation, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bubbee2
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel off the internet. Although it stated it was 4 star I would rate it as a 3 star. The position is excellent only 400 metres from Termini for trains, metro and buses. The rooms are small but very clean and quiet and the bathroom was good with excellent hot water. Room temperature could be decided by your own temperature guage. The breakfast was excellent with a couple of hot dishes every day along with many other cold meats, cheeses etc. The breakfast room was quite chilly and needed a jumper to be worn. The staff were very friendly and superbly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff in a fairly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamBill
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you are arriving by train, with easy access to all the main tourist sights. Friendly, helpful staff and an excellent breakfast. This is not a very big hotel, so don't expect an enormous room with lavish fittings, but everything works, and you will have a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “just awful...”
Reviews.Author: antoineandre
Reviews.Content: We booked via internet a "deluxe quad room" for my wife and my two children visiting rome for the first time. I called before booking just to assure about the quality of the room. my wife arrived at mid day, asked to see the room, they told her it was unavailable. when I arrived later in the afternoon, what a disappointment: instead of a deluxe quad room, we had a basic double room in very poor condition, with two extra single beds on each side of the double bed...so they were crammed in like sardines. after a first complaint at the reception, they propose to change the room the day after...but of course they insisted that I paid the full price. I refused. as soon as I told that we were leaving the hotel, they proposed to show us another room: larger but still in poor condition and definitively not deluxe. I wonder why this room suddenly became available? I confirm that we were leaving. as they insisted on us staying I asked to talk to the manager: he was apparently unavailable, pretending he was on his day off (friday afternoon). I insisted that the receptionnist called him, which she did but refused to let me talk to him directly. We ended leaving. They have refused to give us back our credit card pay slips -- they took two pay slips, one from my wife on arrival and one from me when I arrived!

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Two-Stallions
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days in August and we could not recommend the hotel. The staff were miserable, the rooms, even though we had a junior suite, were small and in poor condition. We moved rooms and the second room was also dire. The breakfast room is below ground level, dark and musty and no way could it hold more than 10 guests at a time. There are no lounge areas, the small courtyard is frequented by smokers and the lift broke down twice (there is a sign in the lift mentioning that it is quite an occurence). Look elsewhere if you wish to stay in the biggest rip-off city I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: hows_AL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 11 nights during a recent business meeting in Rome. Great location being 3 blocks from the Train Station but wihout all the foot traffic. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The price is fair. Some of my friends stay at one of the US hotel chains, paying nearly 3 times more and our room are about the same size. BTW, Royal Court offer free WiFi, free breakfast (depends on rate) and the air condition works well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location by the Termini”
Reviews.Author: caliodie19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only three short blocks away from the main train station (Roma Termini) and offers great accomidations for the price. The breakfast was good, staff was friendly, and location was great for the two days that we were there. The windows (like most in Europe) were single-paned and did not offer much in the way of quiet during the night but it was sufficient. I would recommend this place to friends considering the very good price it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: dks61885
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for its close location to the train station since I would be traveling in and out of there. It is so easy and within walking distance from the train/bus stations. The hotel itself was nice. We arrived before check in, but that was no problem. They check us in and the man at the front desk gave us a few suggestions on where I should start. We went into the room and it was a decent size, but bed took up most of the room, so there was very little walking space or space to put our suitcases. We managed. The bathroom was a decent size, but no matter what we did the floor was always flooded with water after a shower. Just ask for extra towels, it really is no big deal. We ended up booking a tour through the front desk it really is not worth the 120 euros (per person) that we paid. The second day we ended up just getting a daily bus pass and saw what we wanted for however long we wanted. In the tour I felt rushed at some places and we stayed too long at others. The guides were not that engaging either. There was one day that the cleaning staff did not leave any soap in our bathroom (they threw out the one that we already opened) and when we told the front desk about it they said they would fix it, but never did. We had to ask a few times before getting it. Also, got wrong information from the woman that works at the front desk - but thats life. Overall it was a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fuzzylimoges
Reviews.Content: We are leaving tomorrow and just completed our stay at this hotel. This hotel is well located in that it is not far from Termini Station and we were able to walk to all the sites we planned on staying while in Rome. The hotel is run very professionally, when we arrived we greeted right away and the staff attended to our luggage while the front desk took care of our check-in. The rooms are well decorated and very clean. The breakfast was a cold/hot buffet. The only thing that was really disappointing about the room is that my husband and I did not have a good night sleep during our three-day stay. The bed was suppose to be a king size bed, but they were to twin beds put together. Also, the bed was hard as a rock, we felt like we were sleeping on the box spring. For the price we paid I would have liked to have had a good night sleep. If and when we return to Rome there are so many other hotels in this area that we will try another one.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: manras
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our vacation and Morgana Royal was our stop in Rome. We stayed in a quad room which was decent size because it had 4 single beds. The bathroom was nice and clean. The breakfast was the regular, ham, cheese, pastry, cereal, nice coffee. We ate late around 10:00 so nobody was there. We also took our breakfast to our room. The hotel staff is very friendly specially Alexandria. It is very near Termini which made our life so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Yarra1
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent being so close to Termini station. We had an Executive Double room which was relatively roomy and comfortable. Street noise was not a problem when the windows were closed and even with them open the street is a narrow one- way and not especailly busy at night. The breakfast room is too small and often crowded. A couple of the breakfast tables were unstable, easily rocking and some of the tables were pushed very close to others . Breakfast itself was fine and the kitchen staff helpful and friendly. Reception staff were mostly friendly. A great feature was the availability of a free Mercedes transfer one way (either to or from the airport) if staying 6 nights in an Executive Double room. It was a great way to get to Fiumicino!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget choice for those using public transportation.”
Reviews.Author: travelwith2teens_8
Reviews.Content: Small and friendly. The location is great for access to public transportation, it's just a short walk to Termini. Africa Restaurant, located very near, has excellent Ethiopian food, and is a welcomed eating bargain considering the cost of restaurants for Americans right now. They serve an excellent European style breakfast. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room (Rome is too beautiful to waste a second of seeing it), but found it quiet, clean, and staffed with english speaking locals with what seemed like a genuine concern that their guests enjoy themselves. A great budget choic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ki82
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one week stay at the Morgana Hotel. I enjoyed my stay there. The rooms are definitely very small (just enough room for the bed and dresser), although you can upgrade to a deluxe room for a bit more money. The location is excellent, as you are just a few steps away from Termini train station and a number of restaurants and tourist attractions. My only complaint about the hotel was that my telephone in the room didn't work. The staff didn't address the problem until my last day there, which was unfortunate. But overall, the staff were attentive and pleasant throughout my stay. Breakfast was included in my room rate--although it was very basic: pastries, yogurt and fruit. It is convienent for those who only need a quick bite to eat before getting going in the morning. This hotel is perfect for the type of traveler who just needs a clean place to sleep. It doesn't have all of the luxuries of the large american hotel chains, but it's also much cheaper than those types of hotels. If I were to visit Rome again, I would certainly consider returning to the Morgana Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MKE1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the Royal Court in June 2008. A lovely Hotel only 500 yards from the Termini and was located on a quiet side street. We were wary of the location when booking having heard the area around the Termini could be dodgy. No problems at all with this Hotel. It's very private and quiet and perfectly safe. The Hotel itself was spotlessly clean, the Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Continental Breakfast was fine and again no problem if you wanted anything extra or special. Colosseum, Forum and Via Del Corso are all about a 20 minute walk away. With the Termini so close all of the major sites were very easily accessible via the Metro. Could take either Line A or B from the Termini, so it was all very direct. Overall I would very highly recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - Superb location”
Reviews.Author: CabbagesAhoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a travel agent friend. It's location is excellent - it's a 500 yard walk from Rome's central railway termini. On the downside with the window open at the front of the hotel it will be quite noisy - HOWEVER with air con and the windows shut you wouldn't know it was central Rome What really sets the hotel apart are the staff - they were ALL excellent. Very friendly, helpful and fast. I would stay here again in a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Court good value”
Reviews.Author: dan19460
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent city break in Rome staying 4 nights at the Royal Court. We chose the hotel through good Tripadvisor feedback. Rome is a great city to visit and we loved the wonderful sights, the fantastic food and the general friendliness of the folk there. Whilst there were a few slightly negative aspects to the stay, I would not hesitate to recommend the Royal Court to anyone looking for very decent, quiet accommodation of a perfectly acceptable standard in what can be an expensive city. Getting the negatives out of the way first, our room (standard) was really quite tight for space. Having said that, it was quite manageable and the room space was used to the maximum e.g. large wall mounted plasma TV, all drawers within the wardrobe etc. I suspect our room was amongst the smallest in the hotel and you could well find yourself in something more spacious. Secondly, although the continental style breakfasts were perfectly satisfactory, again tables could be full at certain times resulting in a short wait or a bit of squeezing in. At night, there didn't seem to be a bar area as such, though I believe drinks could be arranged. However the lack of an obvious lounge put us off having a nightcap downstairs. No real worries there as Rome is full of wonderful bars and restaurants. There are a few near the hotel but tend to be around 15 to 20 minutes walk away in the main. Maybe the most negative issue was a bit of a slip up by the hotel in arranging a car to meet us at the airport. We had originally planned to take the train in, as Termini Station is only a 7 minute safe walk away. However it became obvious that our flight was going to be delayed to beyond midnight when trains would not be running. I phoned the hotel - admittedly at the last minute from Edinburgh Airport -to arrange a hotel car pick up. Alas it did not show. No matter, a friendly taxi driver took us to the hotel for a similar price (60 euros after midnight). None of the above in any way detracted from the stay. You get really good value here when you check other hotel prices. The rooms were clean and requests (eg more pillows) were dealt with efficiently. There was very little corridor noise and we slept well. Desk staff were really excellent- helpful, cheery and with brilliant English. The location is really good. It is in a nice quiet area that appeared pefectly safe to us. As stated, the station is only a hop away and is great for the metro, tour buses as well as airport transit (provided it's not after midnight!) It is also pretty good from the "seeing the sights" angle. Maybe a 20 minute walk to the Colliseum, the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Half hour to the Pantheon. The Vatican probably needs a taxi or as we did, hop off the city tour bus. Also recommend vising the Trastevere area which is not on many tour bus routes. Plenty excellent restaurants there in an up and coming trendy part of town. In summary, I genuinely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for best value. If you are not expecting 5 star facilities at 3 star prices, you'll not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good find!”
Reviews.Author: Friendship88
Reviews.Content: A very nice and reasonably priced hotel in a good location! The room is small with a 3 feet space all round the bed. But furnishing in room is new with a 33in LCD TV and it is very clean and nice. Breakfast is good (see photo). Front desk spoke good English. The female staff at the front desk was definitely more friendly and helpful. All in, it is a very good choice for a cheap hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best place if you're planning to visit all Rome's attractions on foot”
Reviews.Author: nalbr027
Reviews.Content: Great location if you're planning to fly into Rome and then visit all the attractions on foot. For convenience, we liked this location much better than some of the Luxury Hotels. When you land at the airport, simply jump on the Leonardo Express train (11 Euro's each way) and it takes you right downtown to Termini Station. This hotel is only a 5 minute walk straight down the street. You can actually see the station as soon as you walk out of the hotel. The best way to tour the attractions (Bath, Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, Vatican) is by Subway. The main hub for the subway is at Termini Station so it's great to have a hotel close. 24 hour front desk and the staff all spoke English. Free Breakfast. Very safe inside and outside the hotel. Rooms were recently renovated within the past couple years. Very clean. Housekeeping was fantastic. Everything was refilled and clean towels were provided everyday even though we hung them up to re-use. Overall, the only complaint was the free breakfast (although I probably complain about something provided). It was very European and wasn't what North American's are used to. There was no Orange Juice (just sugary Tang). Milk was warm (again, typical), and there were no eggs. Basically just coffee, pastries, yogurt, and sliced meats. But remember, Termini Station is only 5 min away and it has tons of restaurants - yes, even McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: jillysmail
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel that is very convenient for the station and metro although far enough away from main streets not to be noisy. Making use of the metro in my opinion is essential in Rome so personally I consider this hotel in a great location. Staff were very friendly and helped with metro times at night to ensure we would get back to the hotel. The breakfast room was a little small for everyone to get in at once so some intelligence regarding timing was needed. We booked a deluxe room and were not dissapointed although with such a lovely city to see we did not spend a great deal of time in the room. Have stayed in Ambassiatori Hotel also in Rome but have to say prefered this smaller and considerably less expensive one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: dickensdad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Morgana Royal Court twice (Feb. 2004 and December 2005). This is a nice place to stay on your last night in Rome, since it is only a couple of blocks north of the Termini train station. The last time we stayed there ,we walked to Termini and caught the Leonardo Express to FCO airport. Termini is also a major local transportation hub for local and regional travel. The area to the north of Termini is not bad, while the south side is a bit seedy. We had a booking problem on our first trip, and they had to move us to their sister hotel - the Morgana. We will be visiting Rome again in March, 2008. We are trying the Hotel Golden for the last night in Rome, because it appears to be better value. I checked prices at the Morgana Royal Court, and noted that the per room charge is 160 euros, while the Hotel Golden charges 100 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel. Enthusiatic Staff”
Reviews.Author: alanw888
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Royal Court Hotel. The Hotel is located only about 400 yards/metres from the main railway station (Termini), Metro and Bus Station but most of the tourist attractions if you are considering walking to them are the 'other' side of the station. Open topped Sightseeing buses stop/wait in the busstation. Also, the hotel, is only about 30 yards from the 'Bank of Italy' with its machine gun toting police guards which seems to make it a rather safe area! The Hotel might be best described as a 'boutique' hotel (although I m never really sure what that means). The hotel and rooms are filled with antique furniture, pictures and polished wooden floors but also the necessary modern air con and fridge/minibar. Every room is different so these comments can only reflect the room we sayed in (116). Some rooms had showers, others baths or jaccuzzis.Our room had patio doors leading to a small intimate, shady and tranquil courtyard, Trees, shrubs, flowers and bowls of sweets made this an ideal place to relax, with a couple of beers, after a hectic days sightseeing and before dinner at one of the many local restuarants. Although only two (3?) rooms opened directly on to the courtyard it was accessable to all. There were also lifts to all floors. The staff couldnt have been more helpful and attentive, we particularly liked the 'bellhop/gopher' Romero for whom nothing was to much trouble and always with a smile and at a run... The hotel provided a buffet breakfast although the choices of four cold meats and cheeses were the same each day these were always fresh and never piled high to become 'tired'. The buffet staff kept the quanities small but constantly refreshed, the moment a plate became empty it was immediately filled, an almost seamless and invisible operation to guests. Plenty of choices of fresh fruit, cereals, juices, cream cheeses, yoghurt, jams, bread ,rolls and much more. Breakfast was served between 7 and 10am everyday although the breakfast room was quiet small it was adequate provided everyone didnt arrive at the same time! Prices charge for items from the minibar were quite low compared with other hotels I have stayed at or even the hotels own room service charges but items used were not replaced unless you handed in the 'honesty' sheet at reception each day. It is always possible to find a few things that detract from the overall experience in our case the wash basin plug was too large for the hole so the water slowly leaked away! and the shower tray leaked across the floor and in to the bedroom but only when I used it, I am rather heavy!! My partner is much lighter and no problems. I would also have liked tea/coffee making facilities in the room (Room service was available 24/7). None of these very minor problems could affect our overall view of this excellent hotel. If hotel star ratings refered to the look, feel, atmosphere and staff etc. rather than just the 'on paper' facilities then this hotel would rate far more stars than its allocated 2 star rating. As Arnold Schwarzenegger/The Terminator would say "I'll be back".

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunny38
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Royal Court Hotel and could not have been happier. The location was great, within walking distance to all the top attractions, but a bit further to the Vatican. We took the subway to the Vatican, and it was no more then 5-10 minutes. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful. The area the hotel is located has been reviewed by other as "scummy", or "unsafe", but never did we feel either! It is located across from a school, but this did not cause any problems or noise. The room size was fine for our needs, and we were never bothered by noise. Our friends were in Rome at the same time and chose a hotel on the other side of the train station. It was lovely, but also cost 80euro more per night, and for the amount of time we actually spent in our Room I feel we made a wiser choice. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for the tourist”
Reviews.Author: martyManchester
Reviews.Content: This is a winner from the word go. It's within walking distance to the Rail Station, Metro and the main Bus station. if you want to do a trip in the open top bus to see all the spectacular buildings it starts just across the road from the Buses. The hotel was clean comfortable friendly and the breakfast was more than expected. If you want help in picking nice restaurants then just ask at the reception and they will tell you about places that are so good that the Italians use it theirselves.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: magscarbin
Reviews.Content: arrived by leonardo express from airport to termini.and delighted to find hotel was just 5mins walk from the exit ,turned into a lovely tiny courtyard.up 6steps to reception ,friendly face ,helpful ,porter brought us to a dotey room .Everything you could need for a sightseeing trip to rome.did not find the area any way threatening for two women alone.absoloutly perfect for trains buses and walking breakfast surpassed all expectations.fresh fruit several types of breads meat cheese cakes yogourt juice .no bar but drinks served in a little room and in courtyard also snacks and pasta .could not have been more pleased with this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you want”
Reviews.Author: onmyholiday
Reviews.Content: We visited the Royal Court last week. Booked it as it was central. My view on this hotel is it clean and is OK for a few nights however there was no bar and the one of the receptionists were useless. Hotel is about a 5 min walk to the station however I would say there is not much around the hotel that you can go and stroll about. I would have preferred to be closer to some of the attractions. Also there is no hotel bar so if you want to meet up with friends staying in the hotel there isn't really anywhere. On a positive side the breakfast was good and was always able to get a table in the small breakfast room. I would suggest if you don't mind staying somewhere where you have to get transport to the attractions this place is fine however if you want somewhere just to stroll around then this isn't the hotel. I am a believer of you get what you pay for and in this case I wish I had paid a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: Location: good, close to station termini (5-10 mins walking) and close to Metro station B Line Castro Pretorio Reception: good Room: good first impression with plenty space but bathroom badly designed, old, shower leaking water and way too small Breakfast: ok standard continental in small stuffy room Pros: location Cons: miniature shower, cramped bathroom, won't bore you with details but we ordered room service when we arrived (very late and we were very tired) and it was shocking

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for train station, little else to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Gallivantingtheworld
Reviews.Content: Less than a 5 minute walk from the train station, so it is very convenient, and not too far from some of the wonderful sites in Rome. Hotel Morgana is ludicrously expensive for drinks, so avoid and go to the nearest bar. Their tours are expensive and a hassle to book as a coach takes you to the tour office for payment, and then you wait on further coaches to take you on your way. In our case, there was a big mix up with people aborting and running for coaches and we started our tour more than half an hour late. Breakfast is ok: small selection of breads, cereals, some ham, cheese, jam. Quite small selection, too bad if you're gluten intolerant, or trying to avoid white flour. Long queues to breakfast if you time it wrong as there are only a limited number of tables. Bathroom in our room was ridiculously tiny, and if you're sharing with friends and having to change and get ready in there: get ready to get hot, uncomfortable and frustrated. No knee room to get into clothes at all! Supposedly fully airconditioned. Well, we had a portable unit in our room that pumped out cool air for about 8 inches and then dissipated in the heat. Big, big disappointment. Very hot and uncomfortable when we were there, and aircon unit did nothing to alleviate it. I booked through Thomas Cook, where it's a 3 * 'Signature favourite' - shocking really, because it's closer to 2* and nothing about it except its promixity to the train station is good or special. The elevators are the tiniest I've ever seen, with only room for a tight three! Most inconvenient if a group of you wish to use it. Avoid the pavement restaurants on the street up from the hotel, not particularly good food. Pick somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having never traveled to Europe being met at the airport and taken straight to the hotel was a huge plus. We stayed there for a total of 5 days and enjoyed every day. Fabio, the general manager was extremely gracious and made our stay feel like we were at a 5 star hotel. We stayed a total of 25 days in Italy and enjoyed our stay in Rome the best. After the first day we felt like we were staying with family with all of the staff greeting us as we came and went. They were helpful in getting us train schedules, mass schedules, tourist information, etc. We definetely plan on going back. I would advise not wondering around the neighborhood at night as we went for a walk one evening and were a bit apprehensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Friendly Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In May I went to Rome for the first time with my husband. A work colleague recommended that we stayed at the Royal Court Hotel and that we would not be disappointed. Well he was right! We were collected from the airport by a chauffeur - free of charge, as we stayed for 3 nights and it was included in the deal. We were overwhelmed with all that this lovely hotel had to offer us. Everything was perfect! - The staff were friendly and polite and only to willing to suggest places to eat and places see, the hotel was a small but very elegant, it was delightful and very clean, we even had a Jacuzzi bath... Heaven!! The location was really good. It was quite close to Termini the main train and bus station. At first we were a little bit worried because of the old reputation about the area being a little bit seedy but this is not the case now. All of the main sites were within walking distance with the exception of a few, which were a little too far, but you could hop on the metro or a bus, which is just around the corner from the hotel. I would without a doubt recommend this hotel to anyone. I think that you get a lot for your money! Although they class it as only a 3*, I would definitely say it was more like a 4*. Rome truly is an amazing city, there is so much to see and do, you would certainly want to return! We do and we will without a doubt stay at the Hotel Royal Court again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here during January, and we had no complaints whatsoever. It is handily located just a few min from the termini station, from where you can get all over Rome by bus or the metro. The room and en-suite were clean, as was the rest of the hotel. The staff were friendly and courtious. As it was our first visit to Rome, we found the airport pick-up service to be a nice extra. I have reccomended this hotel to my friends, and i have no problem reccomending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quaint, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: dm3880
Reviews.Content: We were four. 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We had a queen bed and 2 singles. The room was a nice size for Italy, even though we were a little tight because of the amount of luggage we had( remember 2 teenager girls). The bathroom was lovely with a large jacuzzi tub and very spacious. Our room was beautifully decorated with fabric walls and nice furniture, but the beds were a bit hard. The staff was friendly and the hotel is 2 blocks from the Termini Station. This is very handy if you plan on exploring other parts. Overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Morgana Royal Court”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with my girlfriend. We had one of the larger rooms which was quiet nice. The location is really good for getting around. I know this area is a bit on the seedy side at night but we didn't come across any problems. The staff are plesant and the receptionist was paricularly helpful, giving us a map and directions around the city and booking restaurants for us. The only thing I was disappointed with was, one morning we came down for breakfast and it was full so we had to wait until it was almost finished. At this stage most of the buffet food was gone but there was no attempt to refill the bread or juices. Just a small thing. Overall I would consider staying here again if I were to travel to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in a double room in October and I was really happy with the hotel.Room small but clean,bathroom good enough(a bit dark) and extremely helpful staff.You can go to many places walking.Breakfast average with nice waiters. Compared to other hotels in the city this one has a good relation price-quality.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: DALY
Reviews.Content: The first nice thing I'd say about this hotel is that it offered us free transportation from Fiumucino Airport because we were staying more than 3 nights. It was nice to see our name on a placard as we exited customs. A previous review said that the hotel was set back a little from the street- it is not. We had the front room of the hotel, right on the sidewalk. We could hear all the conversations of people walking by. Our room, a quad, was reasonable in size, by European standards, with vaulted ceilings. The furniture is a bit dated although I guess you could call them antiques. The double bed that my husband and I shared was the hardest bed I've ever slept on. While the jacuzzi tub was nice, I was put off by the mold on the grout in the tilework. Breakfast was average, bread, salami, cheese, fruit and cereal. The Termini was about 2-3 blocks away, nice for getting away but the area is really seedy. There are a few restaurants in the vicinity to choose from. There is a laundry place just around the corner. Staff is very friendly and helpful- although one man we spoke to for restaurants at night was not very knowledgeable. All in all, I would not stay here again. The area is just way too seedy. We stayed here only because I couldn't find a quad elsewhere that didn't cost a small fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Darlee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second visit to Rome, (1st time 2002) I would have say that this hotel is average. The rooms are clean but a bit small however we did not spend very much time in it, too much to see and do. The staff we encountered were very helpful and pleasant. The area is not one of the best but it is central enough to walk to many of the sights. We were in a room right next to the new construction but it did not cause us any loss of sleep. Breakfast is adequate (continental - bread, ham, cheese, cereal etc). We booked guided tours with the hotel which were very good and well priced, They collect you from the hotel and return you unless you stay on where the tour ends. On a final note nothing to do with the hotel Rome seems to have been hit with graffiti mania, it is everywhere, do not remember it from previous visit. PS Would like to recommend La Piazzetta on Via Cardinale Merry del Val, Trastevere, Tel ---- great food, price and service, also Angelino ai Fori, Via dei Fori Imperiali, also excellent, Tel 066791121

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for the price - good location from Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: annabelle32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night. The location is extremely convenient to the train station (Termini). Just cross the street after exiting the station and it’s a short walk down via Marghera. That being said, I would not suggest walking around at night by yourself in this neighborhood as it didn't feel all that safe (lots of homeless hanging out on the street corners) and the neighborhood is a lot dirtier than some other sections of town. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. We requested a car service for transport to the Airport for the next day and they were more than happy to assist us. The hotel is set back from the street so this cuts down on any traffic noise. The room was a bit dark but; having to only stay there the one night it didn't bother us. The room & bathroom were nice, clean and good size. The hotel offers a small patio outside but only one table. We did not eat the breakfast that was offered so I can not comment on their food. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you were only looking to stay one or two days -

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as we had read about”
Reviews.Author: Jnbantle
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my family at The Royal Court Marghera in Rome and the room was nice, BUT, there was massive construction going on next to the hotel and all we heard was a jackhammer all morning and day. The hotel never disclosed this to us. They said it would stop on Sunday and Monday because I said we wanted to change hotels. It only stopped on Sunday. On Monday early morning,it started up again and the noise was unbelievable. I asked for a free night and all I got was a measly 20 Euros a night off of my room rate of 226,00 a night. The breakfast buffet was lacking real food and the yogurts were never cold until the last day. The waitress was rude with an attitude and then never showed up on the 3rd day we were there so I was telling the fill in how the buffet needed to be set up and that's when the yogurts arrived cold. The windows are paper thin in the executive room, so they are incorrect in their advertisement of having sound proof rooms. Also, there is a college across the street that the kids are up all night partying and very loud. If I go to Rome ever again, I would not stay there. I would go somewhere closer to the Trevi Fountain. That's a much cleaner and nicer area.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice clean place, friendly staff...but our bed lived up to the worst stereotypes of European sleepware: It was HARD, like a board. I don't know if this was just our room, but it somewhat mitigated the other advantages of the place. Also, we were awoken in the morning by children crying and other ambient noise from the apartment building next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: babylaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in August 2004. We reserved it b/c of the reviews here and the quad room availability (which apparently isn't that common in Europe.) We weren't disappointed. Our room was spacious and the bathroom with jacuzzi tub was great. The staff was really pleasant and helpful. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. The accommodations were clean and comfortable. We reserved a triple and had expected a much smaller room (based on what we had heard of most hotels) - but to our surprise, there was plenty of room for the three of us and our big suitcases. Continental breakfast was good. Need to travel a little distance to see the sites - not much to do nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Friendly Staff but Small Room”
Reviews.Author: YountvilleJoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Court over the New Year's weekend. We travelled with our two teen aged kids and booked a quad room. They put as into a double room to which they had added a twin bed plus a rollaway bed so there was wall-to-wall mattress with absolutely no room between the beds. We complained so two days later they moved us into a larger room where at least there was room for a night stand between the king sized bed and the twin beds. Both rooms had no closet, only a small armoire in the small room and an armoire and a dresser in the larger room. The front desk staff and concierge were very friendly. The rooms were nicely decorated and the breakfast was acceptable. Tip . . . make sure to order cappuccino because the regular coffee is horrible! I would definetely stay there again but would get two rooms instead of a quad. The location is very convenient and they recommended an excellent restaurant just around the corner. Had the room not been so small I would have given it a 5 pt rating

Reviews.Title: “Simply splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramilose
Reviews.Content: August 2004. For my first time on Rome, I picked the Hotel Morgan Royal Court through an online service. Expected Bates motel, got a smaller version of the Four Seasons. The rooms are simply spectactular and comforatable. We took the train from Fumicino Airport (the Leaonardo Express) and walked to the hotel from the Termini (carry-on luggage only for this, wheeled a MUST). For my first trip to Europe, I was worried about the neighborhood, but never had any real reason to worry. The staff, from the desk clerk to the Romainian girl who made breakfast each day, nothing but first class service. My mom, 62, hurt her knee the day before we arrived, at the Acropolis in Athens, and had to get the first flight out early am. The desk clerk gave her the first room on the bottom floor, and got her a car and made sure she got to her plane. We walked Rome and took public transit (Watch out on the Metro, lots of pick pockets, mostly women, be careful). First timers, unlike Greece, you need a local to point you to the quality food establishments. Really. If you don't, you will be eating at the McDonalds in the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a quad room for 5 nights - ample space and huge bathroom with jacuzzi. Service was 1st rate and very friendly. It is less than 5 mins from the Termini Stn and close enough to walk to most attractions. Very safe area, went there with Mum and little sister no problems at all. Would defintely recommend. Good brekky too.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good service and near everything”
Reviews.Author: littercritter
Reviews.Content: i am not sure about the other reviewers and where they live but the hotel is beautiful and is in an excellent location. within one block are the headquarters of unicef italy and the the italian tourism bureau. there are some beautiful buildings around the hotel. the hotel is close to everything unless you think it should be across the street. rome is defined by walking so expect to do some and bring comfortable shoes. also remember to bring an alarm clock to make sure you get up if the wake-up call does not wake you up. buying subway tickets is a waste of time. romans let the foreigners buy the subway tickets and pay the freight so the romans travel for free. notice that all the romans enter the subway station next to the booth where you enter the subway. the attendant never looks to see if you have a ticket or not. save the time and save the money. in all of the times that we were on the subway, we were never asked to, or had to, show a ticket. the hotel room was spotless, comfortable and had friendly staff. check around for prices. we paid 120 euro for a quadruple room (one double and 2 single beds). in USD it was quoted from the low at orbitz to the high of $270 USD at expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, don't let them switch you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Court was wonderful. We had a superior double room, one that doesn't have a jacuzzi, but it was still a great tub with nice hardware. The marble floors in the bathroom were charming and the decore was tasteful and not tacky. The breakfast was also very good. As for the location, many guidebooks will tell you not to stay in Termini (station) area because it's a "tourist ghetto". That may be true to a certain degree, but the convenience of the location cannot be underestimated. We took the metro (a bit crowded, but extremely efficient) and the bus (excellent system) and never had to pay a cab driver once--all we had to do is buy a 16 euro weekly pass for our 7 day stay. We saved a ton of money that way, and with the dollar falling like a rock, my fellow Americans would be advised to do the same. As for safety, the Termini area is populated by many, many police late into the night, and I never felt the slightest bit unsafe, especially wearing a money belt. While other neighborhoods may be hipper or more atmospheric, this hotel is just far enough from the station for a little peace and quiet, and offered many advantages. One warning: our first night, we were told by the front desk that there was a problem with the toilet in our room, and we were forced to spend the night at a sister property, the Hotel Morgana. We were told the hotel was superior to the Royal Court. It was not. Closer to Termini, the hotel is only partially renovated, and we were stuck in an old portion that had furniture out of a trailer park. Even the renovated rooms did not look nearly as nice. The staff was rude and unsympathetic. I had to throw a fit to make sure we got back into the Royal Court our second night. While I don't know if it was a scam or not, be careful, and make sure you don't get switched. After we returned, however, the Royal Court gave us a bottle of wine to make it up to us, which we appreciated, though we don't drink. If it hadn't been for that incident I would have given them five stars. Highly recommend the Royal Court--delightful property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dburkett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal Court for three nights in November 2004. The rooms were small but very clean. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great because it is very near the bus and train terminal. If you plan to utilize the Metro or trains; the location is ideal. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL!!!! Thank you Tripadvisor ++++++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC!!! I did not want it to end! Thank you tripadvisor what a great website… If it was not for you I would not have chosen the Hotel Royal Court. From start to finish our stay there was perfect. The hotel arranged for me and my boyfriend to be collected by chauffer from the airport, which was a perfect start. The hotel was delightful; there are only twenty-four rooms which made us feel really part of the friendly environment and not just a number like the larger hotels. Our bedroom was very luxurious and had the biggest bed in I have ever seen! The bathroom had a Jacuzzi in which was great. The hotel staff was very helpful and could not do enough for us. You can even have breakfast in bed at no extra charge!! The hotel location is great, it is very close to the main train and bus stations so getting around is extremely easy. You could also walk to a lot of the major sights, which is what we did as the weather was fantastic and we could really soak up all there was to see. The hotel staff told us of some really wonderful restaurants locally and to this day the taste of the food has remained with me.. ‘bellissima’. If anyone is going to Rome I would certainly recommend this hotel. In fact my mum and dad have already booked a week there and I am trying to arrange a group of my friends to go there the beginning of next year! Ciao x (p.s. make sure you throw a coin in the Trevi Fountain as they say you will return! …. I threw many!!)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with two friends who had never visited Rome before. We were met on time at the airport and taken to the hotel by the hotel taxi service. Our rooms were excellent and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated near to Termini station which is very convenient for travelling around the city. There are excellent restaurants nearby. We intend to stay at the hotel again and we have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal Court Hotel staff greeted us with a friendly and warm welcome. The Manager and his staff could not do enough for us. Excellent room, Excellent food and Excellent location! What more can we say but EXCELLENT! We will definitely be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: angarg
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a quad room Oct 28, 29, 30, 31 (200 euros / night): this hotel was excellent. the room was huge. the bathrooms were nice. the staff was friendly. the area was easily within walking distance from the train station. it is located in an area that seems to have 10,000 other hotels. i needed a power converter and the hotel staff kindly gave me one. staying at this hotel was simply a great experience. i have nothing bad to say about the hotel, hotel location, or the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Jsmtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family trip began in Rome at the Morgana Royal Court and the location, a short walk from the main Termini train station, was perfect. From there we could walk almost everywhere and if we needed to use the subway or bus we easily got "back home". The room was large, the AC worked well, and the bathroom a real treat (a jacuzzi!). They serve breakfast but the staff was a little overwhelmed by the quantity of people. On the whole, a great location and a hotel I'd return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
