Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights during March of 2004. My wife and I have nothing but good things to say about it. Very clean and comfortable and the jacuzzi tub was a very nice perk. Even though our room was facing the street, it was fairly quiet. No complaints here. The staff was very friendly and the complimentary breakfast prepared us for a long day of touring. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Review and photos”
Reviews.Author: chicagoborn40
Reviews.Content: First, believe all of the reviews on this site of this hotel. They are all accurate and the photos are exactly what you will find upon arrival. We had a great experience compared to the disappointing Hotel Gambrinus (see review). The rooms are huge indeed, by American standards and the bathroom beautiful! Think superior room at the Holiday Inn or a standard room at the Marriott. Great power shower and no temperature problems. The hotel is fully air conditioned as well. Great professional staff, great location (about 2 blocks from the Termini) which was good for side trips to Venice and Florence. There are restaurants very close, within 1 block, to the hotel, also convenience stores, buses, etc. I can't really add more to what others have already said. I'll just say, take everyone's advice, book the room and enjoy your time in Rome! When you travel to Venice be sure to stay at the Antico Doge (see review). It's fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient, and safe ~ close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: thannaroo
Reviews.Content: My 3 sons (20's), 2 of their companions, and I spent 3 nights in 3 rooms at the end of August 2004 at the 3* well-managed (Morgana) Royal Court. LOCATION:It's located 3 blocks NE of Rome's Termini Station. Though close to the train station, this particular area seems safe. It's across the street from a language school with private residences and corner restaurants nearby. Being near the transportation hub of Rome, we could easily walk to the hotel after arriving on the airport express train, catch early morning trains to other cities and also board any city bus after a day of sight-seeing if "Termini" was listed on the destination roster at the bus stops. One advantage of boarding buses at the starting point is you have a choice of seats! We did walk to the Colosseum (1.5 mi) our first day, but Trastevere and Vatican City would have been a stretch. (By taxi, it's 10 Euros to Vatican City from the hotel or 1 Euro by bus). ROOMS: The A/C'd double rooms with walk-in closets (!) were quiet at night, clean and comfortable - elegantly wallpapered with padded brocade. One room was a tad larger than the other two. The rooms were cozy, but not cramped. The large bathrooms were beautiful--marble-tiled floors, bidet (I used mine to soak my feet...)-- our tub/shower had whirlpool jets (!), but the others did not. My son could not understand why they didn't have shower doors or curtains - yes, the floor was a bit wet after his use. BREAKFAST: Very nice continental breakfast - dry cereals, yogurt, salami, mortadella, cheese, and delicious rolls--my sons found the food quite filling and were ready for the day's adventures. AMMENITIES: quiet courtyard entrance, elevator, and rooftop patio (no view) with table/chairs and greenery. This hotel was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: DesignatedPlanner
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Morgana Royal Court Hotel for three nights and were very pleased with both the accommodation and the very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was big for Rome standards, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was luxurious. The room had a safe and a mini bar and the air-conditioning was a welcome relief from the hot outdoors. We were very happy with the buffet breakfast and one morning when my husband was unwell, the wait staff gave me a tray to take food back to our room for him. We discovered the lovely roof top terrace and used it many times to relax after a long day of sightseeing. One can take a drink up to it as there are tables to sit at. There is also a ground floor terrace or "court" but it is very small with only one table which was usually occupied by others, so we did not get the opportunity to use it. It looked very charming, though. The staff were very helpful and they recommended tour options and a good restaurant very close by. In our travels we met a fellow traveler who was happy with her accommodation at a convent and was delighted to pay 95 euros for a single room with breakfast. We paid only 125 euros for a family of four (two adults and two children ages 14 and 17), at the Morgana Royal Court, and therefore feel we got the better deal. Rome itself is very beautiful and there is much to see. I would recommend taking taxis over the Metro. We witnessed a robbery of a tourist in the subway and the crush of people trying to get on is somewhat frightening, especially for children. The taxis are much safer and the drivers are friendly and will sometimes give you a commentary on sights you pass by. The cost is not much more than the Metro if there are four of you. There is also a double decker tour bus, which goes by all the sights and you can get on and off along the route. The Vatican and St. Peter's is not to be missed. One word of warning, however, if you visit St. Peter's: the trip up to the cupola does not tell you the space gets very small and can be overwhelming if you are uncomfortable in small spaces. It is one way up and one way down, so don't attempt it unless you plan to continue all the way. The elevator takes you to the first tier which is stupendous all in it's own. Then you have the option to climb the winding stairway up to the top. Attempt with caution, as it is a very tight fit at the very top.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redmayne
Reviews.Content: Friendly little hotel a couple of minutes from the station. If you get the Leonardo Express from Fiumicino to The Rome Termini don't leave the station by the first exit or you will have to walk all the way round to get to the hotel. Carry on straight ahead and up the escalator to the main entrance and leave by the right exit. The road is straight ahead. Saves a lot of time. The room we had for 4 nights had a Jaccuzzi and air con. After 7 or 8 hours walking, both were much needed. Breakfast is continental with cereal and fruit. A bit of a stroll from the main sights but busses and Metro are both handy. Very friendly staff, they gave us a good tip on where to eat, Taverna Pretoriana just round the corner. Best pasta ever!. Best ice cream? in the station at a self service restaurant on the upper level. Perfect on the way back from town.

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing, though quite expensive (a bit sad when I paid the bill). It's 5-10 minute walk from the Termini station - the most convenient station in Rome I believe. Lovely bathroom - comes with a jacuzzi!! Breakfast was alright. Overall, i enjoyed my stay!
